page.title: 05LOCHGOILHEAD-ECOLOGY(2)
page.content: {BIRDS}-There are over 100 bird species in this area,including many raptors such as{owls,eagle,peregrine and hawk. {PLANTS}-Woods dominate below 400m. Near-natural{oak-birch woods}with{wych {elm,hazel,rowan,alder and ash}remain in patches.They are rich in{lichens, {bryophytes and fungi.}One such wood in Hells Glen is a SSSI.Plantations of conifers cover most lower slopes.New plantations are mainly{sitka and {larch.}Rhododendron and bracken invade younger woods. Above 400m. there is more grass than heather.The tops have skeletal soils low growing plants.e.g. racomitrium. { {POLLUTION}-There is little pollution. { {INSECTS}-There is a fantastic variety of insects. e.g.{dragonflies,damsel {flies,beetles. MIDGES ARE ABUNDANT.}
